      • keyPairGenerate

        public static java.security.KeyPair keyPairGenerate(int bitkeysize,
                                                    java.math.BigInteger publicExponent)
                                             throws IllegalArgumentLtRtException,
                                                    java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                    java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        When generating RSA key pairs, you normally try to choose a value for the public exponent and allow the private exponent to be derived from that accordingly. The JCA allows you to specify both the key size you want and the public exponent for RSA.

        For example, if you wanted to specify one of the standard public exponents such as the value F4, recommended in X.509, and the default for the Bouncy Castle provider, you passes the argument publicExponent with the value java.security.spec.RSAKeyGenParameterSpec.F4
        Parameters:
        bitkeysize -
        publicExponent -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentLtRtException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
